explanation: The report is correct. In OS_DoSelect, ts_end is computed and later read only in the branch where msecs > 0 (the else-path inside the do-loop that computes tv from ts_end). The memset(&ts_end, 0, sizeof(ts_end)); is executed only in the else of the initial if (msecs > 0) (i.e. when msecs <= 0), and in those cases ts_end is never read. Removing that memset will not change the functional behavior of the routine for msecs == 0 or msecs < 0, so the call is an executed operation whose removal would not affect program behaviour and thus meets the definition of dead code in MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. (If there are external non-functional timing requirements such that the extra write materially affects system behaviour, that would be a special case to document; absent that, the memset is redundant.)
